page.title: 06Lea and Holloway Fairground
page.content: {Paul May}and{Hayley Wadeson}both live on{Yew Tree Hill}and when their parents began to dig in their gardens they discovered lots of clay pipes, bits of broken pottery and old coins dating back to 1727. Also discovered was a piece of jewellery and a silver shaped heart with a bird on it. Apparently the land was not just an ordinary field at all. A hundred years ago, or more, it used to be the place where the village people held their annual fair. There were children's roundabouts, all pushed round by hand, side shows and pottery stalls. We dont know for sure, but perhaps people would bring their produce like jams and pickles, and probably chickens, with children running, shouting and laughing. The fair was held on the nearest Sunday to November 12th.
